They repeatedly and heavily tried to steer us to use Chrome, which is not an option since Chrome is an excessive memory hog and Google is far too nosy. Consumer Cellular, as technical a company as it is, shouldn't have an incompatible issue with you. It is the only company we've ever been given this lame excuse. Perhaps they, like too many other companies, are in bed with Google.

Help?

title: Adding an internal range to firefox intune policy management for access control
content:
Hi All, I want to block traffic on firefox externally for managed devices via Intune, following the import of the ADMX/ADML files into intune.

I have set '\Mozilla\Firefox\Exceptions to blocked websites' to the following

  • //*.mydomain.com/*

which works, however, I also want to add hosts that are only resolving on IPs and not DNS. I can add specific IPs if known, but is there a way I can allow IP ranges? Ie

  • //10.10.*/* (this doesn't currently work)

Of the included screenshot, only the wildcard for mydomain.com and the specific IP currently work

If there is a better way to do this via intune for firefox only, please let me know.

Thanks

title: Potential Security Error, occurs on many sites but not all.
content:
I went to work and when I returned a new router was installed and ever since I get errors on almost all sites I visit. It is the potential security issue, requires secure connection and when I look into the info it says the certificate is being denied because it is self signed. And anytime I go to hit learn more I receive a 400 error and cannot continue. I am also unable to update apps I have on my pc or connect to the internet using anything besides a browser. I get the same kind of error on edge as well as Firefox.

I have already set things up so I am using no proxy and I do not have https only mode enabled.

The only constant is that I can open YouTube and watch videos. I thought this meant it was a dns issue but I have tried several fixes for dns issues and they didn't work.

I would attach photos of the error but Mozilla is also unable to open due to the errors so I'm filling this out on mobile.
creator: drakesfortune3923

title: Have tried Firefox's PDF editor and so far adding text is fine.  I also need to export a PDF into other formats like png or jpg for image editor like Paint or Photoshop or Affinity.  Does Firefox do this?
content: Before I stop paying for a PDF editor, I need a function that I can't find in Firefox's new PDF editor, so far. I need to be able to delete and replace text. In the past I have needed to export the PDF as a *.jpg file into a program like paint or Photoshop, erase the text, save the document again as a PDF and import back into the PDF-editing program and add then add the new text. I don't see how to save a PDF as another type of file in Firefox. What am I missing?
